CatDescriptText: Mrs. M. Wasler, 2173 Hermans Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �No I positively do not. I think that they have gone far enough.  Zones would make things a little different.  Why should you pay 25 cents to go from Downtown Pittsburgh to Kirkpatrick St., while others pay the same fare to go to the end of the line?�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. M. Wasler, wearing eyeglasses, coat with Persian lamb collar, and dark hat and gloves, standing in front of Emma Jetticks Shoes, Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
